resources:
T-UI Notification Reader >> $ T-UI got SU permission Your device isn't rooted You have to grant Storage permission Version: An unknown error has occurred Turn on GPS or network location Invalid integer
T-UI is busy, wait until the execution finishes or use the command "ctrlc" type "ctrlc" to stop

Do you like my work? Rate on Play Store (command: >>rate) or offer me a coffee (command: >>donate). Thank you for using T-UI. 

You can disable this message with the command "config -set donation_message false" First time with t-ui? Use the command "tutorial" or "help"
Application not found state: hidden state: shown
Share Lock the screen on double tap Errors:
Calling: t-ui will be closed in some seconds. Click the home button to restart it
No matches You didn't grant the permission Waiting permission calc encountered this error: There was a problem while connecting to your device camera Wrong number format Invalid argument Less arguments than expected
Alias not found: There was a problem with your alias
Print the list of commands, or info about a command 
Usage: 
help [command] 

Example: 
help exit
Exit from tuixt (changes won't be saved) Save changes You pressed back key Saved Reading TUIXT
Nothing was found
WiFi active: Mobile Data active: Bluetooth active: Airplane Mode active: Can't use this feature on your Android version
Cant't write here. It's a file This is a directory File not found This file is not readable You can't write or delete this file

App installed:
Playing: Player stopped Player wasn't started Couldn't stop the player. Force stop t-ui from settings Music folder doesn't exist, or doesn't contain audio files.
You should set the right path in settings.txt
Command not found.
Try to use ">>help" or ">>tutorial" More arguments than expected Invalid option: Command returned
Flashlight ON Flashlight OFF Your device doesn't support flashlight
Battery charge: Mobile data: WiFi:
Francesco Andreuzzi (Italy)
	-> Programmer 

Luke Winward
	-> Design & Testing 


Open Source Libraries: 
CompareString
Refresh: apps, alias, music, contacts Thank you!
write your SMS or nothing to abort Contact not found SMS not sent SMS sent
Toggle Airplane Mode Manage your aliases 

Usage: 
-add -> add a new alias 
-rm -> remove an existing alias 
-ls -> list your aliases 
-file -> open alias.xml 

Example: 
>>alias -add bip echo beeeeeep 
>>alias -rm bip Manage your apps 

Usage: 
>>apps [option] [app name] 

-lsh -> show hidden apps 
-show -> show an hidden application 
-hide -> hide an application 
-l -> show details about an application 
-ps -> show Google Play Store page for this app 
-st -> show Settings details for this app 
-frc -> force t-ui to open this app 
-file -> open apps.xml 
no option -> list your apps 

Example: 
>>apps -st T-UI
Toggle Bluetooth Clear the screen Perform basic operations (+ - * / % ^ sqrt) 
Example: 

>>calc 4+2-5 
1 

>>calc 7 % 3 
1 

>>calc 2 ^ (2*2) 
16 

>>calc sqrt25 
5
Make a call 
Usage: call [number] OR [name] 

Example: 
>>call James 
>>call 3283456789
Go to the t-ui community on Google+ Manage your config files. 
Usage: 
>>config [option] [file OR config_entry] [*value] 

-set -> set the value of a config node 
-open -> open a config file 
-get -> get the value of an option 

Example: 
>>config -set bg_color #ff0000aa 
>>config -open suggestions.xml Copy one or more files to a folder 
Usage: 
>>[su] cp [files] [folder] 

Example: 
>>su cp fool.txt fool2.png myFolder 
>>cp myFile.txt myFolder
Toggle mobile data. Will always turn off if WiFi is active Donate something to the developer Toggle the flashlight Print the list of commands, or info about a command 
Usage: 
>>help [command]
Move one or more files to a folder 
Usage: 
>>[su] mv [files] [folder] 

>>su mv fool.txt fool2.png myFolder 
>>mv fool.txt myFolder
Play the next track in the queue Play a specific track 
Usage: 
>>listen trackname
Play the last track played Help T-UI with a positive rate (or negative, I don't know)	;) Refresh apps and alias Restart t-ui and load modified values Remove a file: 
Usage: 
>>[su] rm [files] 

Example: 

>>su rm fool.txt fool2.png 
>>rm Downloads/fool.txt
Search something somewhere 
Usage: 
search [option] something 

-g -> (Google Search) 
-p -> (Google Play Store) 
-f -> (Files) 
-y -> (YouTube) 

Example: 
>>search -p T-UI
Share a file 
Usage: 
>>share pathToFile 

Example: 
>>share fool.jpg
Print Terminal Emulator commands Get infos about battery charge, wifi status and mobile data Stop the player Print current time Print informations about the current track Print all of the tracks in your music folder Open the text editor. 
Usage: 
>>tuixt [text file]
Usage: 
t>>tui [option] 

-rm -> remove t-ui 
-about -> show info about the developer and the current version 
-reset -> Removes t-ui folder and resets default settings (restart required) Open the tutorial page on GitHub Uninstall an application 
Usage: 
>>uninstall appName OR packageName 

Example: 
>>uninstall dropbox
Toggle wifi Send an SMS. 
Usage: 
>>sms [contact name] OR [phone number] {newline} 
>>[text] 

Example: 
>>sms John Smith 
>>Hi John, I need to talk you about T-UI, it's a fantastic launcher! Vibrates your device. 
Usage: 
>>vibrate [ms] 

Example: 

vibrate 2000 Emits a beep. 
Usage: 
>>beep Manage your notifications. 

-inc -> include an application 
-exc -> exclude an application 
-clr -> set the color to be used for the application 
-file -> open notifications.xml 
-title_filter -> set a filter over notifications title ([id] [regex]) 
-text_filter -> set a filter over notifications text ([id] [regex]) 
-apply_filter -> apply a filter to a particular application ([id] [application]) 
-access -> show the system settings page dedicated to the Notification Access 

Example: 

notifications -inc Clock 
notifications -clr Settings #FF0000 Show the current location Manage your contacts. 
Usage: 
cntcts [option] [*optional* contact] 

-ls -> list your contacts 
-l -> show details about a contact 
-new -> create a new contact 
-edit -> edit an existing contact 
-rm -> remove a contact 

Example: 

cntcts -edit James Pike 
cntcts -new Close T-UI and reset launcher preferences
Change the current directory 
Usage: 
>>cd [path] 

Example: 
>>cd /storage/sdcard1/DCIM
Open a file with the default application 
Usage: 
>>open [pathToFile] 

Example: 
>>open docs/fool.txt
Print a list of the files in a directory 
Usage: 
>>ls [directory] 

Example: 
>>ls Downloads
T-UI started T-UI is running
